availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hiram Hagan (Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer and politician)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer and politician. Kentucky native. Father of James P. Monroe. Farmer in Monroe County in 1850. Farmer in Monroe County in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Monroe County from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 370B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 148.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Precinct 6, p. 191A.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1877) 630.
KYR-0001-004-0369.
